Consider this silly time series process:

$$
y_t
=
\alpha
+
\varepsilon_t
+
\theta_1
\varepsilon_{t-1}
+
\theta_2
\varepsilon_{t-2}
,\quad \varepsilon_t\overset{\text{iid}}{\sim}\text{N}(0,\,\sigma^2).
$$

Derive the joint distribution of $\mathbf{y}=\begin{bmatrix}y_1&y_2&\cdots&y_T\end{bmatrix}^{\scriptscriptstyle\mathsf{T}}$. In particular...

a. What distribution family does the joint distribution belong to? Justify your answer; don't just assert it.
b. Derive the mean function:

$$
\mu(t)=E(y_t).
$$

c. Derive the covariance kernel:

$$
\gamma(s,\, t) = \text{cov}(y_s,\,y_t),\quad s,\,t\in\mathbb{N}.
$$

d. Is $y_t$ stationary? Why or why not?
